title: Upgrade pybind11 to avoid its bug
body_html:
Pybind11 has a bugfix here: pybind/pybind11@96997a4 which is not included in pytorch master.

In brief, the bug causes two python modules, when both compiled with buggy version of pybind11, to conflict and crash at import.

I've upgraded pybind11 for House3D last week when debugging its conflict with pytorch. Hope pytorch can also upgrade to avoid potential conflict with other libraries.
body_text:
Pybind11 has a bugfix here: pybind/pybind11@96997a4 which is not included in pytorch master.
In brief, the bug causes two python modules, when both compiled with buggy version of pybind11, to conflict and crash at import.
I've upgraded pybind11 for House3D last week when debugging its conflict with pytorch. Hope pytorch can also upgrade to avoid potential conflict with other libraries.
body:
Pybind11 has a bugfix here: https://github.com/pybind/pybind11/commit/96997a4b9d4ec3d389a570604394af5d5eee2557 which is not included in pytorch master.

In brief, the bug causes two python modules, when both compiled with buggy version of pybind11, to conflict and crash at import.

I've [upgraded pybind11 for House3D](https://github.com/facebookresearch/House3D/commit/b115ecc43244c52ed0d11f64bf416c830376937e) last week when debugging its conflict with pytorch. Hope pytorch can also upgrade to avoid potential conflict with other libraries.
